addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord
e Erle of Essex.

D
r
Birch's Memoirs Vol [.] Page [215]

page.lettertext:
fol.108r
May it please yo
r
good L. Heare I send yo
w
the copies of two intercepted l
re
s, having also
sent
e like unto my
L. T
re
r
. They were sent
from
Brussels
for
Rome,
and written by one
William
Creytton
a Scottishe Jesuit, a man of credit and
experience, and the chiefest plotter, as I have heard,
of these troubles in
Scotland.
One of
e l
re
s is ad-
dressed to Cardinal Caetan, and
e other to
e G
nr
al
of
e Jesuites.
Thomas Tyrie
, who is thought
to be
e man, that can doe them so muche good, is
nephew to
James Tyrie
, in time past a famous pro-
fesso
r
among
e Jesuites of
Paris,
but nowe abiding
in Rome. The L. Humes, and
e wife of Thomas
Tyrie, are brother and sisters children.
Of all other maters I have written to yo
r
L. the
22 of this moneth.
And so I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage Fe
b
26 1594
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
